message: This post is all over the internet today. It explains to non-programmers the different kinds of challenges/obstacles that we programmers face in our work.
name: Programming Sucks
caption: stilldrinking.org
description: Every friend I have with a job that involves picking up something heavier than a laptop more than twice a week eventually finds a way to slip something like this into conversation: "Bro,1 you don't work hard. I just worked a 4700-hour week digging a tunnel under Mordor with a screwdriver."

data.message: This guy is very talented at describing his feelings towards bad code :D

"Doing this all day leaves you in a state of mild aphasia as you look at people's faces while they're speaking and you don't know they've finished because there's no semicolon." :D Terrific article. I laughed so much.
